com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications

Class Bubble

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications.Bubble
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FadeEffect.Fadeable

    public class Bubble
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
implements FadeEffect.Fadeable
    Instances of this class represent contextual information about a UI element.

    Bubble will attempt to always be visible on screen.
    If the default Bubble would appear off-screen, we will calculate a suitable location to appear.

    Bubble utilizes the system font, and provides a constructor to indicate use of a bolded font.

    Bubble will also break up lines that would be longer than 400 pixels when drawn.
    You can short-circuit this logic by providing your own line-breaks with \n characters in the text.
    We will never format your text if your provide your own formatting.

    • Method Detail

      • createBubbleForCustomWidget

        public static Bubble createBubbleForCustomWidget(Bubblable bubblable,
                                 java.lang.String text,
                                 BubbleTag... tags)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates and attaches a bubble to a component that implements Bubblable. This is a convenience constructor which assumes you do not want the Bubble text to appear in a Bold font.
        Parameters:
        bubblable - The Bubblable element that the Bubble provides contextual help about
        text - The text you want to appear in the Bubble
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parentControl or text is null

      • createBubbleForCustomWidget

        public static Bubble createBubbleForCustomWidget(Bubblable bubblable,
                                 java.lang.String text,
                                 boolean useBoldFont,
                                 BubbleTag... tags)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates and attaches a Bubble to a component that implements Bubblable
        Parameters:
        bubblable - The Bubblable element that the Bubble provides contextual help about
        text - The text you want to appear in the Bubble
        useBoldFont - Whether or not we should draw the Bubble's text in a bold version of the system font
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parentControl or text is null

        Parameters:
        parentControl - The parent element that the Bubble provides contextual help about
        text - The text you want to appear in the Bubble
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parentControl or text is null

      • addTags

        public void addTags(BubbleTag... bubbleTags)
        Add tags to a previously created Bubble.

        Tags can be shown by calling BubbleRegistry.getInstance.showBubblesByTag(BubbleTag tag)
        Parameters:
        bubbleTags - Tags to associate with this Bubble

      • removeTags

        public void removeTags(BubbleTag... bubbleTags)
        Remove tags from a previously created Bubble.
        Parameters:
        bubbleTags - Tags to un-associate with this Bubble

      • deactivateBubble

        public void deactivateBubble()
        Remove the Bubble from the Component.
        Note, this will also dispose the Bubble. Future interactions with this Bubble will result in Widget Diposed exceptions.

      • fadeOut

        public void fadeOut()
        Fades the Bubble off the screen.

      • getIsFadeEffectInProgress

        public boolean getIsFadeEffectInProgress()
        Returns whether the Bubble is currently fading from the screen. Calls to Bubble.isVisible() will return true while the Bubble is dismissing.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the Bubble is currently fading from the screen

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Returns whether the Bubble is currently visible on screen. Note: If you utilize Bubble.fadeOut(), this method will return true while it's fading. To determine if it's fading out, call Bubble.getIsFadeEffectInProgress
        Returns:
        Visibility state of the Bubble

      • isDisableAutoHide

        protected boolean isDisableAutoHide()
        Returns a boolean describing whether or not auto-hide functionality is disabled for this Bubble.
        Returns:
        Whether or not auto-hide functionality is disabled

        protected void setDisableAutoHide(boolean disableAutoHide)
        Tells the Bubble whether or not it should auto-hide when the user mouses off the Bubble'd item.
        Parameters:
        disableAutoHide - whether or not auto-hide should be disabled

      • fadeComplete

        public boolean fadeComplete(int targetAlpha)
        Implemented as part of Fadeable.
        Users should not interact directly invoke this method.
        Specified by:
        fadeComplete in interface FadeEffect.Fadeable
        Parameters:
        targetAlpha - The targetAlpha you defined as part of the FadeEffect.
        Returns:
        True if the component is at the desired alpha, false otherwise (continues the FadeEffect execution).

      • fade

        public void fade(int alpha)
        Implemented as part of Fadeable.
        Users should not interact directly invoke this method.
        Specified by:
        fade in interface FadeEffect.Fadeable
        Parameters:
        alpha - The current alpha in the effect (will start at the target alpha and end at the target alpha).
